headline: Trump Steps Back From Hollywood's Biggest Bidding War For Warner Bros-Netflix Media Merger: 'The Justice Department Will Handle'
summary: President Donald Trump signaled a major shift in his administration’s approach to the media landscape on Wednesday, announcing he will not personally intervene in the blockbuster $82.7 billion merger between Netflix Inc. (NASDAQ:NFLX) and Warner Bros. Discovery Inc. (NASDAQ:WBD). Reversal Of Influence In an interview with NBC News anchor Tom Llamas, the President reversed his December stance, where he had suggested he would be “involved in that decision” due to concerns over market concentration

Reversal Of Influence In an interview with NBC News anchor Tom Llamas, the President reversed his December stance, where he had suggested he would be “involved in that decision” due to concerns over market concentration

headline: Disney sidelines streaming in 2026
summary: In Warner Bros./HBO's (WBD) "Succession," Waystar-Royco chooses Tom Wambsgans, head of Parks & Cruises, to succeed Logan Roy as CEO. In real life, swap that for Disney (DIS) choosing Josh D'Amaro, head of Disney's Experiences Unit (Parks, Cruises, Gaming & more), to succeed Bob Iger as CEO. ...

headline: Netflix Warner Bros. Discovery Bid Tests Scale Growth And Investor Expectations
summary: Netflix has proposed an $82.7b acquisition of Warner Bros. Discovery, including HBO Max and key content franchises. Regulators in the U.S. and Europe are examining potential antitrust issues tied to the deal. U.S. Senate hearings are actively probing the implications for competition and consumer choice. A competing bid from Paramount Skydance adds uncertainty around who will ultimately control Warner Bros. Discovery. For investors tracking NasdaqGS:NFLX, this potential deal comes at a time...
